thread.title: 'You came here to die, Mr Bond' – 007 gets a chilling warning in final SPECTRE trailer
thread.title_full: 'You came here to die, Mr Bond' – 007 gets a chilling warning in final SPECTRE trailer

title: 'You came here to die, Mr Bond' – 007 gets a chilling warning in final SPECTRE trailer
text:
We STILL don't know if he is actually playing iconic baddie Blofeld, but he's plenty scary enough either way. 
"Look around you, James. Everything you believed in are ruins," purrs Waltz. 
"Why did you come?" Daniel Craig as Bond in the explosive Spectre trailer SG I can smirk better than you... Daniel Craig and Christof Waltz 
And then we get a classic exchange of steely-eyed machismo as the two craggy warriors face each other down. 
"I came here to kill you," shoots Craig. 
"And I thought you came here to die," volleys back Waltz. 
"Well, it's all a matter of perspective," smirks our hero. 
It's cheesy and a little bit camp and we love it. 
Still not quite as cheesy as Sam Smith's Spectre theme tune which hit No.1 today – the first Bond song ever to top the UK charts. SG SG Has anyone ever actually said no to 007? 
Elsewhere we get another glimpse of Lea Seydoux as Madeleine Swann, the daughter of Bond's old assassin enemy Mr White. 
It seems the icy beauty may hold vital clues to help 007 unravel the tangled and wicked web around SPECTRE. When she's not busy kissing him, of course... 
We see Bond engaging in fisticuffs in the crowd in Mexico City during the fiesta for the Mexican Day of the Dead. 
We see him running and leaping to outpace a falling building.
